page.title: 10SHEEP DOGS, COLD ASHTON.
page.content: On Sunday, Sept. 29th, 1985 a{sheep {dog trial}was held at Oldfield Farm, Marshfield with a view to establishing a regular form of{rural entertainment and a continuity of skills involving shepherding and working sheep dogs. {Sheep}are freed 400 yards from the shepherd and his dog. The dog is then commanded to bring the sheep to his master by the most direct route through various gates and obstacles. The drive is completed when the dog and sheep reach the pen, the gate of which is held open by the shepherd. Once the dog has penned the sheep, the shepherd closes the gate. The site was ideal for the event, giving a good view to the 1.000 {spectators.}Facilities were excellent, food and drink being available. Marshfield W.I. had a stall with garden produce and home baking
